original_title: Two acres of plantation land for Sri Lanka’s Rangala police station
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka Police is to acquire two acres of land from Duckwari Estate belonging to Udupussellawa Plantation Company to build the Rangala Police Station.

“The cabinet approved a proposal by Minister of Public Security Tiran Alles, to acquire a two-acre land to establish the Rangala police station,” Cabinet Spokesman, Bandula Gunawardena said on Tuesday (12).
The Rangala police currently function in a building belonging to Gatagahawela Plantation Company on a rental basis, he said.
“Due to insufficient space, the officers find it difficult to perform their duties properly.”
According to the Sri Lanka Police website, there are 607 police stations and more than 90,000 staff. (Colombo/Dec13/2023)
